intro: Lampranthus francisci, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to yellow, often resembling tulips. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Lampranthus francisci is also known for its succulent leaves and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
